text: Bottle at home, 26th January 17. Pours still and clear, dark amber. Aroma is fruity, sweet, caramel. Taste is sweet, slight bitter, fruit, caramel, slight wood. Its OK, a little like a barley wine.

Semmi hab, szűretlen borostyán szín. Illatában a komló és fehérboros aromák jelennek meg. Édes, enyhén fehérboros, fűszeres ízvilág. Enyhe karbonáció, szinte semmi keserű. Testes, nagyon kellemes, jó összhangú, nagyon kellemes sör.

0.33 l bottle. Hazy orange color, no head. Sweetness, alcohol, malts, dried fruits in aroma. Sweet fruits (orange hints) in taste with strong alcoholic overtone. Leaves a warm mouthfeel. Medium to heavy body.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Bierzauberei Aleysium 1852 (English Burton Ale) ].[ Courtesy of my Local Swap 2015-2 - Saeglopur ]. ABV: 10.2%. Clear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity malt, caramel, pale malt, dried fruit, oxidide, sweet malt, alcohol, sugary. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, dried fruit, alcohol, pale malt, sweet malt, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily and sticky, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160109]
Bottle. Frothy White fair mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Some candis notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.
Bottle @ Saxo tasting. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, sugary and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish with lots of alcohol. 090116

Bottle, 10.2%. Hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, spices, toasted, little ripe fruit with notes of alcohol. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, ripe fruit, berries, sweet, warming, notes of alcohol and a little bitter.
Bottle @ my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, yeast, malt and hops. Sweet finish.

330ml bottle at Sternbräu Rankweil. Aroma is strong malt, toffee. Appearance is light cloudy golden to amber with a nice white foam. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. A soft carbonation, light dryness. Very good.

0.33l bottle. Slightly murky deep orange body, almost no head. Aroma of caramel, orange zest, bread yeast and booze. Taste is quite similar to the aroma. Orange zest, toffee, millet and booze. Bit similar to a sahti for me.

From a bottle at the Bevog 2nd anniversary. Pours a light amber golden color, topped with a medium small white head. Aroma of sweet white wine, slightly soury. Taste is similar. Soury, cellar feel to it. Mild sweet as well with alcohol easily noticeable, a bit boozy actually. Not my favourite.

(Bottle 0.33l) Dark golden, slightly hazy colour. Off white to beige, small, medium fast to fast falling head. Medium to full body, oily texture, low carbonation. Aroma: Strong malty, pale malts, soft honey, strong fruity, melon, apricot, soft herbal hops, soft vanilla Taste: Medium sweet, fruity, melon, apricot, mango, soft bitterness, soft alcohol. Medium long to long, sweet, licorice and fruity finish. Rich in aroma, easy to drink, good hidden alcohol.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
White creamy head. Hazy orange body.
Aromas of hop, hop fruit, citrus, orange, mango, light apricot, creamy, marzipan, herbal... Bit like a DIPA.
Flavour is hoppy, hop fruit, alcohol, bitter, herbal, lot of hop and yeasty fruit tones, banana, apricot, citrus, etc, creamy, light woody... Again like a DIPA.
Aftertaste is a mix of hops, bitters, fruits, herbs and some yeasty woody hints
Low carbo, creamy close to silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Nice stuff! Like a DIPA/Barley Wine.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: APR 20, 2015 bottle at home. amber, clear color. small off-white head. smells liqueurish, alcoholic, malty, honey, dried fruits, plums, light glue. overall quite like the smell. full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel, a lot of malt sweetness, honey, liqueurish, (warming) alocholic, also glue-like notes, some dried fruits again, apricot, some light hoppy grass and pine notes on the finish. finish is lightly bitter / alcoholic. overall quite good, the glue-like / sharp alcoholic taste is distracting and too strong for me, but appart from that i like it.

Bottle. Cloudy red amber, low offwhite head. Musty fig-like, apple, vanilla, wooden (cedar), earthy, light mineral notes. Medium body, dry mouthfeel. Feels a bit rough around the edges, but it is certainly very interesting and a direction worth pursuing further.
Bottle. Aroma peach, fruity, caramel. Lightly hazy golden-orange colour. Taste is peach, fruity, alcohol, boozy. Enjoyable, nicely hiding the actual alcohol content. All in all quite enjoyable beer.
Bottle at home. Pours orange color, white head. Aroma of peach, orange, sugary, jam. Taste is sweet, peach, orange, honey, alcohol is very hidden.
Bottle from Beer Store Vienna. Orange amber color with medium white head. Sweet malty aroma with honey, light hops. Sweet malty taste, banana, peach, honey, light hops. Not very tasty.

(Bierzauberei Aleysium 1852 (English Burton Ale)) Bottle 330 ml at home, gotten from Saeglopur and the Euro Local Swap, another high ABV beer just like I asked, thanks Thomas! 10.2% Served into a snifter.
Deep golden orange colour on the body, almost two fingers of off-white head, thick and with good retention, leaving medium lacing behind. 
Aroma of malts, grass, some sugar, faint caramel, apricot.
Sweet and fruity taste, apricot, peaches, some grass, lots of melon,well hidden alcohol, great!
Medium thick body, soft carbonation. Mildly dry palate.
Very satisfied by this one and surprised as well. Tasty!
Süß hefiger Antrunk, erkennbar aber nicht störend alkoholisch. Leicht steigende Süße, etwas karamellig. Zum Ende mehr Kräuter. 11/9/9/9/8/9

Bottle from Beer Store Vienna. Pours amber, pretty white head, lots of zippy carb. Aroma is caramelly, slightly dusty hop character. Big sweet, tooth-melting sugar hit on first taste. Fair old hop punch to this, lots of fruity estery character from the yeast. Overwhelmingly sweet, though, to its detriment.

330 ml bottle. BB 26/03/2016. From Geiserich. Vielen Dank Michael!
Amber colour with a tiny white head.
Fruits... sweetness... maybe melon... but also something nice... in the aroma.
The flavour is fruit punch... 100%. Some malt, alcohol and a lot of sweetness.

33 cl bottle. BBE 26.03.2016. Thanks rosenbergh!
Pours golden color with a small head. Very fruity aroma, honey, some sugary notes and wheat. Sweet honey flavor, oranges, honey melon notes, caramel and some hay. Quite overwhelming sweet aroma here, too sweet for me.
6325

330 ml bottle. Thanks rosenbergh. Pours a dark golden colour with a small head. Aroma of apricot, sweet caramel, some floral notes and herbs. Flavour of sweet caramel, strong orange notes, tart citrus, some herbs, graininess and floral bitterness. Medium bodied. Alcohol warms. Very sweet, fruity, citrusy finish. If you have a sweet tooth, have this.

Bottle. Light cloudy amber body with fast disappearing head.Aroma is sweet and fruity with herbs. Taste is sweet and malty with caramel and herbs. Aftertaste is alcohol, slightly bitter and sweet. Nice one.
Pours a hazy amber colour. Tastes very sweet to me..............................

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy deep amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy eisbonbon and peppermint, with a hint of tobacco, cardamom, some black pepper, herbal hops and heavy vanilla. flavour is rather sweet, with big notes of caramel and banana, more eisbonbon, a faint floral hoppiness and a hint of earth and peaches in the finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation. good stuff!

0,33 l bottle BB 26.03.2014 
Orange, Mango, citrus, floral, cereal, banana, amber-orange color, cloudy, frothy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bottle: Golden, orange color, creamy off-white head. Aroma is malty, alcoholic, dried fruits, caramel, grass, herbs, citrus peel, spices. Flavor is malty, sweet and round. Honey, alcohol, spices, dried apricots in rum, herbal hop bitterness.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelgoldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, Karamell, grasig, hopfig. Geschmack trocken hopfig, süß, würzig, alkoholisch.

Dieses Bier ist farblich eine perfekte Referenz für "goldgelb". Kräftig und nur minimalst getrübt macht dieses Ale dem Auge richtig Freude. Nicht zu intensive Schaumbildung, aber kurz bedeckt eine reinweiße feinporige Schaumschicht fingerdick das Bier. Aromatisch will meiner Nase zunächst nicht so ganz trauen - ist das wirklich Ananas? Jawohl ist es! Und zwar extrem kräftig. Ebenfalls vorhandene Zitrusnoten übernehmen nur begleitende Funktionen. Und dann eine deutliche Spur von Koriander. Auch wenn dieses Bier sicher zu den stärkeren zählt - im Antrunk merkt man nicht viel davon. Sehr fruchtig süß gehalten ist der Alkohol gut versteckt. Malzige Noten wechseln sich mit würzigen Koriandernoten ab. Die Kohlensäure ist extrem fein und aktiv ausgefallen und spielt lebhaft an der Zunge. Die süßen Töne werden im Verlauf immer schwächer und machen nun dem Alkohol und ersten kräuterartigen Hopfennoten Platz. So langsam beginnt man den Alkoholgehalt zu realisieren. Im Finish kommt der Hopfen zu seinem großen Auftritt. "Bühne frei", denn mit einer begleitenden Kräuternote kommen nun die Bitterhopfeneinflüsse und machen den süßen Aromen den Gar aus. So ganz schaffen sie es nicht, aber die Hopfenbittere klingt herrlich an Zunge und Gaumen aus. Viel mehr Komplexität ist fast nicht mehr möglich.

Bottle from Bierzauberei. Golden, slightly amber clear body with a beautiful big, creamy, white head, with small and medium bubbles. Aroma of yeast, must, honey, spices, bread, some citrus. Tastes of spices, grass, bread, honey, bubblegum, earth, some yellow fruits, very complex, great balance between a light bitterness, sweetness and earthyness! Full body with a creamy texture, lively carbonation and a smooth spicy and bready finish. The high ABV isnt really noticeable, very smooth to drink. Great! Easily the flagship beer of the Bierzauberei, very complex and greatly balanced, it offers a uniqueness you wont often find in Austrian beers!

On tap.
Opalesquent orange golden colour, medium sized creamy off-white head, soft carbonation.
Intensive nose of in alcohol dipped fruits.
Aroma includes mango, peach, orange, honey and herbs escorted by distinct alcohol.
Crisp, slick and sticky mouthfeel.
Medium to long, dry and liqueurique finish with citrusses, bread-crust and spices.
Enjoyable.

Bottle, pours golden with a reddish hue. Musty heavy aroma, not the best. Crisp with a snap at first. Taste of hops, herbal spice, and (considering its high content) a little hint of booze. Then rolls on the sweet sugary bubblegum flavor. Reminds me of a good barley wine, a damn good one. Really an exciting brew!

500ml bottle. Cloudy golden colour, a lot of sparkling is going on, with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Caramel malty aroma, herbal and grassy hoppy overtones. Taste is initially dry to bitter hoppy, subtle sweetness, later with intensening perfumed character, a soapy touch of coriander, some citrus.

This is a truly remarkable beer. Seems perfect to me. Hops and fruity flavours, spices, winelike alcohol-body, carbonation, head, nose: It all makes a perfect match. Probably the best beer I have ever drunk.
Too bad it is quite strong and not cheap at all, so it will remain a beer for very special occasions.

Csodás illat-szentháromság. Édes-fanyar-keserű. Méz, hárs, muskotály, őszi- és kajszibarack. Grapefruit, vérnarancs, koriander, gyanta, virágos komló. Fűszeres édesség, mely átcsap egy natancslikőrös fanyar és olajos keserűségbe, Egzotikus gyümölcsök, mangó, papaya, és határozott de aromás, likőrös komlókeserű, Apró, behízelgően elegáns buborékok, finoman alkoholos test, intenzív nyelvet, szájpadlást összerántó aromás keserű. Lenyűgözően gazdag és izgalmas sör.
